intro: Lindsaea mazaruniensis, commonly known as the Mazaruni lindsaea, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds that are typically green and covered in fine hairs. This plant is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Guyana and Suriname. Lindsaea mazaruniensis thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing capsules, are located on the underside of its fronds, typical of many fern species.
